ci_support_linux_64_c_compiler_version7f:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '7'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge,defaults
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- condaforge/linux-anvil-comp7
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '7'
libnetcdf:
- 4.7.4
mpich:
- '3.3'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.6.* *_73_pypy
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version

about.description:
VIC (Liang et al., 1994) is a macroscale hydrologic model that solves full
water and energy balances, originally developed by Xu Liang at the University
of Washington. VIC is a research model and in its various forms it has been
applied to most of the major river basins around the world, as well a
globally.
about.summary: Variable Infiltration Capacity (VIC) Macroscale Hydrologic Model

about.description:
VIC (Liang et al., 1994) is a macroscale hydrologic model that solves full
water and energy balances, originally developed by Xu Liang at the University
of Washington. VIC is a research model and in its various forms it has been
applied to most of the major river basins around the world, as well a
globally.
about.summary: Variable Infiltration Capacity (VIC) Macroscale Hydrologic Model

name: vic

about.description:
VIC (Liang et al., 1994) is a macroscale hydrologic model that solves full
water and energy balances, originally developed by Xu Liang at the University
of Washington. VIC is a research model and in its various forms it has been
applied to most of the major river basins around the world, as well a
globally.
about.summary: Variable Infiltration Capacity (VIC) Macroscale Hydrologic Model

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "VIC" %}
{% set version = "5.0.1" %}
{% set sha256 = "05cdc39a80ad175f5a9d17fbf5a414f1ff069ddc8b1c76f2e3d66cbfc93f9522" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/UW-Hydro/{{ name }}/archive/{{ name }}.{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}
  patches:
    - cc-env.patch  # backport https://github.com/UW-Hydro/VIC/pull/894
    - ffi-fix.patch  # backport https://github.com/UW-Hydro/VIC/commit/1a34c2cfcae9d09c1f7f2a8aaaeaf24edab4c21c

build:
  number: 8
  skip: True  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - make
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - mpich
    - openmp
    - libnetcdf
    - cffi
  run:
    - python
    - mpich
    - libnetcdf
    - cffi
test:
  imports:
    - vic
  commands:
    - vic_classic.exe -v
    - vic_classic.exe -o
    - vic_image.exe -v
    - vic_image.exe -o

about:
  home: http://github.com/UW-Hydro/vic
  license: GPL-2
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Variable Infiltration Capacity (VIC) Macroscale Hydrologic Model'
  description: |
    VIC (Liang et al., 1994) is a macroscale hydrologic model that solves full
    water and energy balances, originally developed by Xu Liang at the University
    of Washington. VIC is a research model and in its various forms it has been
    applied to most of the major river basins around the world, as well a
    globally.
  doc_url: http://vic.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/UW-Hydro/vic

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jhamman
    - bartnijssen
    - tbohn
